title: Are there any accurate pictures of Prophet Muhammad or not? - Quora

response.answer_text: No not at all, because Prophet Mohammed prohibited us from making it. He has concern that if there's a painting or statues of him, people might worship him similar to Jesus the son of Mary. In a Hadith he mentioned that, if someone makes statues, in the day of Judgement, Allah will ask them to bring life to them. And following one. Sahih Muslim. A'isha reported: Umm Habiba and Umm Salama made a mention before the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) of a church which they had seen in Abyssinia and which had pictures in it. The Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) said: When a pious person amongst them (among the religious groups) dies they build a place of worship on his grave, and then decorate it with such pictures. They would be the worst of creatures on the Day of judgment in the sight of Allah. (Book #004, Hadith #1076)

None whatsoever. None of the people who saw him and knew who he was portrayed him in art, and the emissaries who returned from him didn't do so either, it wasn't exclusive to the Muslims. The Persians and others who included him in their artwork always did so with him in sumptuous apparel that he didn't own and with a veil descending from his turban that covered his face completely.

The Prophet Was Aware That If Some People Saw His Face, Then They Would Start Worshiping Him As God Or Son Of God, That's Why He Himself Told Everyone That He Is A Human, (Example : [1]List of people claimed to be Jesus - Wikipedia) Say, "I am only a man like you, to whom has been revealed that your god is one God. So whoever would hope for the meeting with his Lord - let him do righteous work (Qur'an 18:110) Footnotes[1] List of people claimed to be Jesus - Wikipedia

There are No pictures or images of Prophet Muhammad PBUH as he prohibitted to do it as images , statues was the reason of idol worship from the start as shown in the below video. But there are hadiths on his looks precisely from his companions.
